title: Semipresidential system pres. appt. prime minister

content.question: Russia’s constitution provides for a semipresidential system in which of the following ways?

choices.label: The president’s choice for prime minister must be approved by the Duma.
The prime minister is responsible for appointing the president.
The prime minister is the commander in chief of the armed forces.
The head of state is the prime minister and the president is merely a figurehead.
The president focuses on domestic affairs and the prime minister focuses on international issues.

content.answer: The president’s choice for prime minister must be approved by the Duma.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors of a course country.
